FuncDef: The display igmp-snooping bas invalid-packet command displays statistics about invalid IGMP messages on BAS interfaces.
CLIs: display igmp-snooping bas invalid-packet { user-id <user-id> | all | all-user } [ message-type { report | leave | query } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays statistics about invalid IGMP messages with a specified user ID on BAS interfaces.
user-id specifies the user ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Displays statistics about invalid IGMP messages on BAS interfaces of all users.
-

Displays statistics about invalid IGMP messages on BAS interfaces of each user respectively.
-

Displays statistics about the invalid IGMP messages with a specified message type on BAS interfaces.
-

Displays statistics about invalid Report messages on BAS interfaces.
-

Displays statistics about invalid Leave messages on BAS interfaces.
-

Displays statistics about invalid Query messages on BAS interfaces.
-

Examples: Statistics of invalid packets for user-id 1280:
Invalid Multicast Source : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Statistics of invalid packets for all users:
Invalid Multicast Source : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Statistics of invalid packets for user-id 1280:
Invalid Multicast Source : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Statistics of invalid packets for user-id 1281:
Invalid Multicast Source : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
Invalid IGMP Version     : 0           Invalid Multicast Group  : 0
ExtraInfo: To check statistics about invalid IGMP messages on BAS interfaces, run the display igmp-snooping bas invalid-packet command. The command output helps determine whether invalid messages cause unsuccessful creation of IGMP entries.
